glsa.title: PPP: Buffer overflow
glsa.synopsis: A buffer overflow in PPP might allow remote attackers to cause a Denial of Service condition.

background.p: PPP is a Unix implementation of the Point-to-Point Protocol

description.p: A buffer overflow was discovered in the rc_mksid function in plugins/radius/util.c in PPP when the PID for pppd is greater than 65535.

impact.p: A remote attacker could cause a Denial of Service condition.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All PPP users should upgrade to the latest version:
